export_format.description: Patient data exported as JSON files, one file per patient. Files include Base64-encoded binary attachments (PDFs, Word docs, etc.) and embedded CCDA XML. DateTime values in UTC. Export can be run for a single patient or a population.

clinical.evidence: Problems (PatientProblemDetailsList), Test Results (PatientTestResultsList), CCDAs (PatientCcdaDetailsList), Treatment Summary (PatientTreatmentSummaryDetailsList), Care Management (PatientCareManagementInfo with PrimarySite, SecondarySite, StageofCare)

secure_messages.evidence: Secure Messages category (PatientSecureMessageDetailsList) with fields: Date/Time, Sender, Recipient, Subject, body

billing_financial.evidence: No billing, charge, claim, payment, or financial categories. Searched for billing|charge|claim|payment — no matches in data categories.

insurance_coverage.evidence: Insurance exists only as two fields (Insurance, InsuranceNote) within Registration Details — not a dedicated insurance/coverage category. No eligibility, authorization, payer, or benefit data.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: Appointments category (PatientAppointmentsDetailsList) with fields: AppointmentType, AppointmentSubType, Status, StartDateTime, EndDateTime, Location, Institution, Provider, Notes

documents_images.evidence: Multiple categories include Attachments sub-fields. Chart Notes includes Attachments: [FileName, FileContentType, FileContentBase64]. Binary files are Base64-encoded in the export. Medical Notes reference FilePathToMedicalNoteFile.

audit_trails.evidence: No audit, access log, or tracking categories. Searched for audit|access.log|tracking|who.viewed — no matches in data categories.

issues: No downloadable documentation artifact (PDF/ZIP) — documentation is inline HTML only
No billing or financial data categories — significant gap for EHI completeness
No insurance detail beyond two registration fields
Medical Notes explicitly excludes binary documents ('not including any binary documents included with the notes')
Educational Materials lists only titles/dates, 'not including the materials themselves'
Documentation is minimal — field-level detail is field names only (no data types per field, no descriptions per field, no value sets)
summary: Equicare Health provides a single-page HTML specification for their JSON-based EHI export covering 17 data categories focused on cancer care coordination (navigation, treatment summaries, survivorship plans, questionnaires). The export includes secure messages, appointments, clinical data, CCDAs, and Base64-encoded attachments. Notable gaps: no billing/financial data, no detailed insurance, and no audit trails — though some of these may reflect the system's specialty scope (cancer navigation, not full EHR). The inline JSON example is a helpful touch, but field-level documentation lacks data types, descriptions, and value sets for individual fields.
